nirali.rajen: Thank you for sharing! This hits close to home for me
thenewcobian: Jenn - your posts scare me bc you’re so honest and raw and free. Your dancing videos are my literal goal in therapy. Like, written in my medical record referencing you, your Instagram page and your dance videos. I want to be free enough in my mind and in my body that I could dance. Depression sucks but you’re pretty fucking rad. What if you just decide to feel all the feelings; knowing that they won’t last forever and you’ll be bright and shiny again shortly. Idk. #notatherapist #atall
urbanyenta: Thank you for sharing. I hope you realize how much you are loved and how this helps people coming to terms with their illness

yocruzie: Thanks for putting into words what I find difficult to express and therefore making us all feel understood and not alone. Godspeed to you ❤️
berriosita: Oh damn @jengotch . Thank you for these words. They are exactly how I feel when I enter a depressive episode. lopes_ash: This too shall pass. When I am in this place I have to remind myself this over and over...🤗
jessruthfitness: This is ME! I’m crying just reading how perfectly you describe what I can’t find the words to. Knowing I’m not the only one helps, so thank you for sharing. airgreenwood: I want you to know that you are not alone. Many of us live in this same corner of the world. The reality of it can feel crippling and uncertain. I turn 35 today, have. O relationship with my family & while it’s for the better - it’s always hard during this time of year. I’ve decided the way I can thrive most often is to only give energy and space to things that are good for me (mind, body and soul) and by saying goodbye to people and things that drown me. I can’t carry the weight of the world and neither can you. Smiles are fake. Many people are fake and self serving. I wish I could just hug you and give you a real smile telling you it’s going to be ok. You are not alone.
ly.di.a: Amazingly put, you’re so good with putting emotions into words that I could never explain! Keep going girl you can do this, I’m going through the same at the moment and it’s so relieving to hear someone else is struggling too, we can both get through xx

kismetknits: This is so great. (Obviously not great) I’ve been in a ‘depressive episode’ for about a year and it’s not cool! It’s like being possessed, by an emo teenager demon! This resonates with me today and I solute your fake smile with one in return! We got this 🙃🙂🙃🙂🙃🙂

alicialutes: My friend @baadumching sent me this post, @jengotch, because to say I am right there with you is an understatement. ksealeschmidt: I love your podcasts! You’ve made a difference in my life- a good difference. ☀️🦋

linds3yjo: all of this resonates so much. thank you for articulating this- me too. ❤️ sending lOve to you!
laroth214: Please don't drink....it makes the depression and anxiety so much worse.❤️💜
stexy02: We all know this smile and have it on our photos. Perfect illusion for the audience. Cause we don't want to make them worry about us... So, we're smiling and maybe they're smiling for the same reason and we all just look so happy, healthy and content. Like we should. 💃🕺💃🕺

erin_wadley: You are so amazing. You have no idea how many people you help by being so open and truthful! rockwhitit: 💗💗💗💗💗 This is everything I’ve ever wanted to describe to myself & those closest to me, but haven’t had the right words or strength to articulate and admit. Thank you for helping so many of us pinpoint the crazy highs and lows of this monster.💗💗💗
valeriekiserdesign: I hope this post helps to alleviate some of the pain and sadness. Sending strength and love your way. I hope the light climbs inside soon. ✨ thank you for sharing.
becomingjolie: This is one of the most comprehensive and on the nose descriptions of a depressive episode. Saved it because I’m sure it will come in handy in the future. Your human worth is not measured by these episodes, and your open heart is a gift to us all. Hoping it passes soon.
elenacarvell: I sympathize so much with you Jen. I quit my job earlier this year because I was so depressed I couldn’t function anymore. The exact opposite of how I am when I’m not depressed, I had been so stable for years that I honestly thought I was cured too. I forgot how to deal with the overwhelming emotions and anxiety. I stopped taking care of myself or seeing my therapist or even talking to my mom because I didn’t want to worry her. I feel like I don’t even know who I am anymore. Sometimes I break through for a few days or a week but it’s just been that cycle as I’m sure you know. Just know that you are such a hero to me and so many others. Having bipolar, we’ve made it through before somehow or the other. It’s hard to remember how, but that light at the end of the tunnel is there ☀️ you’re so much stronger than you feel right now 💖🌈
kadoodle58: The ONLY positive to recurring depressive episodes is that I can tell myself, “I’ve won this battle before. I will win it again “. You will come out on the other side even fiercer than before.
rebeccabillybob: Xxx can totally relate , at moment my task is to go to work and come home , as my agoraphobia is on a high at moment. It awful cos I love my job but at moment it feels a chore due to my anxiety and I only hope the love I have for my job is hibernating n not gone xx
kaptainkirkster: But that hair though! Thanks for sharing Jen, you aren’t alone. I’m having a similar episode whist on an oh so dreamy vacation. The most crushing part for me is feeling like a burden, not being able to perk up for those around me and feeling oh so awful in the face of so much to be thankful for. It’s crushing in itself. I’m sorry we both feel bad, but thank you for letting me know I’m not unique or alone in this melancholy. Today I felt much better, I hope you and I both feel this way tomorrow.
elisataub: And hang in there. It will get better.
pamelajbates: Jen, very sorry you are feeling so low. I'm glad you are with people who love you.
picamy: Thank you for sharing your truth! This is so important for others to receive, myself included.
rosetruesdale: You inspire me so much @jengotch! I had an anxiety attack on my anniversary trip to Paris last week and felt like suchhhhh a dummy but I'm not and neither are you.
derafrances: i know this well. @paddedlife see? not just me. thanks for sharing, jen. especially when you're not feeling well.
chattycathy1111: I’m sorry you’re in the ‘claws of the beast’ - as I’ve come to call it. I’ve had major depressive episodes in my life. I also get seasonal effective disorder (SAD) around this time of year, without fail. I started using my light therapy box a week ago as I felt my mood slipping. It has helped but I need to stay vigilant with my self-care. If I don’t ... I’ll be taking a belly-flop into major depression again. That’s often a pattern with me in December. I know what you’re experiencing is a far cry from the seasonal blues. I’ve been very low at times in my life, so I’d like to think I have a pretty good idea of the torment you’re feeling now. You have remarkable insight into your depression; you express it clearly and with raw emotion. I’m relieved (for you) that support is all around. As you said, there’s little I or anyone can say to make you feel better right now. Please just know that your spirit, your essence, the true you, are NONE of the things you’ve labelled yourself. You are loved. You are lovable. You’ll be in my thoughts. Love and light, dear Jen.
dogloverepeat: You’re a brave and strong woman with many gifts. What you’re doing here - it takes strength and guts and precious energy. Yet you’re doing it. Helping countless others. shopdavidpeck: You’ve got this and a load of people who think you’re pretty awesome!
amyazzarito: You sure look beautiful! Good fake smile! This is why I love the yoga philosophy of the ‘only thing that constant is change’ - which is both scary when things are going well and a comfort when they are not. ❤️
nicole.schonig: Hang on girlfriend. It is so beautiful on the other side. You got this. ❤️
saraannstyle: Anytime I go awhile feeling “normal” I think I’m cured as well. Like I’ll never have anxiety, depression, or mania again. Or even a bout of ptsd and then bam. It hits me. I totally get this. 💜
jaurielupiter: it is uncanny having BD, following you and your posts and stories, and hitting a depressive episode at literally the exact same time. my heart hurts, I’m holding out for both of us (and anyone else down here with us). kellygolightly: So sorry Jen. I know what it’s like to feel trapped in your own body/mind. The best thing that helped me was remembering This too shall pass. Hugs.
czechtheocean: Hang in there & let it be over soon. 💓
karen.in.the.citay: OH, I get it... the big D usually finds a back door or crack to enter. You? You are not your depression 💛
heidi__loves: I can relate to this so much @jengotch My smiling face is so good sometimes I can convince even myself. Depression is for me like a layer of tar that slowly covers more of me and makes me feel like I'm suffocating. Like a birds feathers in an oil spill rendering it stuck, stationary, and unable to carry on with its nirmalday to day duties. Or being starved of oxygen like a candle flame, until I'm nearly completely gone...then miraculously but also unnervingly, the overwhelming feeling is gone as quick as it arrived. Occasionally I'm left feeling like I'm coming round from a bad migraine, foggy and achey, memory dazed...its a test, thats for sure, but you're not alone, just as I'm not 😊😘
katieocon: I’ve never read such an accurate description of that soul sucking feeling of depression. I’m sorry it’s decided to pay you a visit and praying for a swift exit. Thank you for sharing your raw and honest heart with us.
kels_1228: Hit the nail right on the head! Right there with you!!💗
simonestewy: But your hair is SO. DAMN. LONG.
swahrey: Thanks for sharing! By giving the internet your feelings, you receive love and compassion in return. #goodtrade - Keep Working it today! Do tomorrow, tomorrow 🍰
nmn2005: I have goosebumps, I understand these feelings so much. It sucks, really sucks.
sitwithwhit: This is such a eloquent and beautifully put description of depression. Thank you ❤️
jules_sontag: The way you give voice to these terrifyingly foreign feelings is such an inspiration. Even in the darkness your light shines so bright! Just know that what you do makes a very real difference. Wishing you a gentle and speedy recovery. 💕

a_space_called_home: @jengotch - you are such a leader and inspiration! Your brutal, authentic honesty is something that many people with depression can’t mimic. You are a success - you need time. alisonryno: Your words and your thoughts, even though at times sad, are positively contagious to others❤️ Thank you for your honesty and passion✌🏽
21ellebee: Oh Jen I’m so sorry to hear how badly you are struggling. The brain is a powerful weapon/tool. I’m so so sorry and praying you get over this bout quickly. 💜
alyssmcc: I went through this recently so I am relating so so so much. It will pass. Just be. Just stay you, whatever that looks like on any given day. You aren't really in control of this which means you aren't at fault. It just is. Let it be and welcome its passing when it comes. ♥️✨

cadencevinyls: I’ve been in one too, @jengotch . lucylitchfield: Ditto. I have all this too. You will come out the other side soon, keep hope with you always xxx

kid_kiwi: This is exactly how I’ve been feeling for the past several months... pretty much since mid-August / early-September. drapagnetta: Expertly put. I was watching a show recently (You on Lifetime) where a woman asked her guy if he thought she was unremarkable. Your post reminded me of that because an awful person would never think this: I actually got scared that I was cured. That I wouldn’t be able to relate to the suffering.. You know the drill. Ride it out. The wave will pass. Everyone you take care of and attend to will be ok while you take a time out. Thank you for sharing. ❤️
